thread.title: Amazon Prime Day: Tool deals every auto enthusiast will love
thread.title_full: Amazon Prime Day: Tool deals every auto enthusiast will love

author: Jeff Sherwood, Knoxville Business Examiner
title: Amazon Prime Day: Tool deals every auto enthusiast will love
text:
During the Amazon Prime Day one-day sale that kicks off on July 15, 2015, there will be several tool deals available to shoppers who need to make auto repairs or get their vehicles road-trip ready. Image courtesy of Getty Images 
The Amazon Prime Day sale will start on July 15, 2015 at Midnight PT, according to a press release by Amazon . There will be hundreds of tool deals available exclusively to Amazon Prime members throughout the duration of the one-day sale. Anyone who is not currently an Amazon Prime member can start a 30-day free trial to gain immediate access to the Prime Day sale and the thousands of tool deals that will be included in it. Prime Day will feature more tool deals than Amazon released during Black Friday and will include thousands of deep discounts and free unlimited shipping on other items as well. 
Here are a few of the featured tool deals to look for during the Amazon Prime Day sale: Save up to 50% on select tools for the DIY auto enthusiast Connected Car and Scan Tool products starting at 60% off Road-trip-ready automotive products starting at 50% off 
There will be thousands of tool deals available throughout the Prime Day sale. Some of the deals that will be available will come in the form of Lightning Deals which will be limited in quantity, so any shopper who wishes to get a great deal will need to be as quick as possible to add the deal to their cart and checkout before the deal expires. There will be thousands of shoppers competing for the same items, and Lightning Deals are usually sold out within a matter of seconds depending on their popularity. 
The Amazon Prime Day sale will also feature thousands of deals on items in categories all across the Amazon website. Shoppers will be able to get their back-to-school shopping done as well as mark birthday gifts and other gift-giving occasion items off the list. This is also a great opportunity to beat the holiday crowds and get some holiday shopping done. Anyone wishing to get a jump start on the deals should take a look at the sneak peek of Amazon Prime Day that Amazon released.
